segment.tokens: Pacu ( paËˆku ) is a common
used to refer to several common species of omnivorous South American freshwater fish that are related to the piranha
several common species of omnivorous South American freshwater fish are related to the piranha
Pacu piranha do not have
piranha have pointed razor-sharp teeth in a pronounced underbite
whereas pacu have squarer straighter teeth like a human , and a less severe underbite , or a slight overbite
Additionally full-grown pacu are much than piranha
reaching up to 0.9 m ( 3 feet ) and 25 kg ( 55 pounds ) in the wild
Pacu is a of Brazilian Indian origin
When the large fish of the Colossoma genus entered the aquarium trade in the U.S. and other countries
they were erroneously labeled pacu
In the Amazon the term pacu is reserved to smaller and medium sized fish in the Metynnis , Mylossoma and Myleus genera
The Colossoma macropomum fish are known as tambaqui
whereas Piaractus brachypomus is known as pirapitinga
= = Classification = = Pacu with their piranha cousins are a characin
meaning a kind of tetra
belonging to the Characiformes order
The ongoing classification of these fish is often contentious ichthyologists basing ranks to characteristics
characteristics may overlap irregularly
( see Cladistics )
DNA research sometimes confounds clarifies species ranking
Ultimately classifications can be rather
Pacu with piranha are currently further classified into the Serrasalminae subfamily
Serrasalminae means " serrated salmon family "
is a
refers the serrated keel running along the belly of these fish
However dental characteristics feeding habits further separate the two groups from each other
Each of these groups contain one more separate species

= = Location habitat = = Pacus streams in the Amazon and Orinoco river basins of lowland Amazonia , where they form part of the highly diverse Neotropical fish fauna
where they form part of the highly diverse Neotropical fish fauna
They have also recently been found in the riverine systems of Papua New Guinea , where it is believed the fish has been introduced to aid the local fishing industry

as newcomers to an ecosystem pacu may out-compete native species for available food , habitat , and other resources

More recently South American rivers including the Amazon have become a popular destination for recreational anglers , who go to fly fish for pacu
recreational anglers go to fly fish for pacu
The International Game Fishing Organization has sponsored for native Brazilian fishermen
fly-fishing courses
typically accustomed to subsistence fishing
so they can work as guides to fishing tourists
When bait-fishing in pacu-stocked ponds anglers in Malaysia are advised to use circle hooks size 2 larger
anglers in Malaysia braided leather rather than nylon leaders which are easily broken by the pacu 's teeth
nylon leaders are easily broken the pacu teeth
Since pond pacu often nibble at the bait taking it
anglers should let
them swim away with the bait

Theodore Roosevelt wrote catching eating pacu in his book Through the Brazilian Wilderness
He described them as " good-sized , deep-bodied fish " "
He noted "
They were
eating
Amazon
Today the river is experiencing a crisis of overfishing
Both subsistence fishers their commercial rivals compete netting large quantities of pacu , which bring good prices at markets in Brazil and abroad
pacu bring good prices at markets in Brazil and abroad
Aquaculture may relieve the overfishing crisis
Aquaculture improve food security boosting fish supplies
Various species of pacu are increasingly being used for warm-water farm fishing around the world
Pacu are considered ideal for their tolerance of the low-oxygen water in farm ponds
They also do n't require a lot of expensive protein in their diet
They can be raised year-round in warm or temperature-controlled environments
Research shows the " flavor of [ farmed ] pacu superior to catfish "
that the " flavor of [ farmed ] pacu is to that of hybrid striped bass , tilapia , and rainbow trout superior to catfish
In South America pacu are prized for their sweet , mild flavor
Aquarium-raised pacu can be cooked
Aquarium-raised pacu eaten
care should be taken to ensure
that no chemicals medicines were used in the aquarium
Heather Candelaria provides a recipe preparation instructions on the Greater Seattle Aquarium Society 's Web site
= = Incorrect claim of testicle-biting = = In 2013 a pacu specimen was found a fisherman in Denmark
This led to media reports mistakenly warning that the fish could attack male testicles

that the fish could attack male testicles
